Muriel Martin-Harvey https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muriel_Martin-Harvey 0 Margaret Muriel de Melfort Martin-Harvey (4 October 1891, London – 15 December 1988, Hillingdon, London) was an English stage actress. Martin-Harvey was born to actors, London-born Angelita Helena Margarita (née de Silva) and Essex-born John Martin-Harvey. She made her debut in 1921 in The Bear Leadera, and later toured the United States and Australia. She also played the leading role in two silent films. She was the daughter of the actors John Martin-Harvey and Angelita Helena Maria de Silva Ferro. Her brother was the actor Michael Martin-Harvey. Martin-Harvey married three times. She firstly married Ronald Squire in August 1924; they divorced the same year. On 15 July 1926 she married actor Garry Marsh, an actor 11 years her junior. She later married Anthony Huntly-Gordon, who was the company and stagemanager to the Agatha Christie thriller The Mousetrap at the Ambassadors Theatre for 21 years. Margaret_Muriel de Melfort_Martin-Harvey ( 4_October_1891 , London – 15_December_1988 , Hillingdon , London ) was an_English_stage_actress . She made her_debut in 1921 in The_Bear_Leadera , and later_toured the_United_States_and_Australia . She also played the_leading_role in two_silent_films . She firstly married Ronald_Squire in August_1924 ; they divorced the_same_year . On 15_July_1926 she married actor_Garry_Marsh , an_actor 11_years her_junior . She later married Anthony_Huntly-Gordon , who was the_company_and_stagemanager to the_Agatha_Christie_thriller The_Mousetrap at the_Ambassadors_Theatre for 21_years .
